body.name: Instant Ice Cold Pack (6” x 5”) - 25 Packs Disposable Instant Ice Packs for Injuries | Cold Compress Ice Pack for Pain Relief, Swelling, First Aid, Toothache, Athletes & Outdoor Activities
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 15 hrs 18 mins
features: INSTANT RELIEF - NO FREEZER NEEDED! Just squeeze the center of the flexible ice pack to activate the single use disposable bags to make them as cold as ice. Apply cold packs to injury to reduce swelling, inflammation and pain for about 15 minutes per bag.

FIRST AID KIT ESSENTIAL - Each pack measures 6” x 5” making it ideal for most common sports injuries and body parts including: ankle, elbow, head, neck, shoulder, hip, foot, wrist, knee, calf and the perineal area. Add it to your household or car first aid kit for instant relief always on hand.

BULK SAVINGS FOR EVERYONE - Enjoy our 25 count bulk savings pack and save BIG compared to your local pharmacy, sports retailer or big box store. Great for families - adults and kids, and individuals who live active lifestyles, play sports and enjoy the outdoors.

REDUCE SWELLING - Using these disposable first aid ice packs to compress injuries immediately after they happen can help control swelling, pain and bruising. The moments immediately after a muscle or ligament injury are crucial to reduce swelling and promote faster healing.

PREMIUM QUALITY - Our ice packs are disposable for easy use as an instant cold compress. The tear resistant exterior won't leak or tear and can be safely transported in your hiking equipment, sports bag, travel luggage, car, first aid kit, or stored in your medicine cabinet at home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Needed asap after surgery: they work!
reviews.reviewText: After knee surgery it was important that I had a backup to my backup ice, really a thing, so I bought these. Well, I needed them and boy did they work! First off, it was easy to travel with (which is why a back up to my back up was needed). They can fit in a bag and toss in your car ready to go. When my large ice pack was no longer working and I was still out boom these were right there and ready to go. They are easy to activate and stay cold for a good amount of time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These ice packs are super convenient to keep on hand! They're easy to use: shake the bag, then fold over the bag to pop the inner bag and shake it to mix everything together. It can be a little challenging to pop that inner bag, but it gets cold pretty quickly and remains cold for about 15 minutes for a quick burst of targeted treatment. Good value for the convenience and peace of mind having these in your first aid kid provides!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my husband to keep one or two with him when he goes to work. He works out on oil rigs and often times gets injured and needs an ice pack. So far they have been a great investment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected.
reviews.reviewText: Got these for first aid kits. Coldness lasts quite a while (20-30 minutes)and seem to be good quality as well as a perfect storable size. Slightly difficult to pop when activating them, but I prefer that so they don't activate if the first aid kits get bounced around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for camping, sporting events and first aid kits
reviews.reviewText: I was excited about the AllSett Health Instant Ice Cold Packs. I’ve used similar items in doctor’s offices before, so I knew how quick and effective these kinds of things are.Our family enjoys camping and hiking. I try to keep a good first aid kit handy for the unexpected injuries (as well as the nosebleeds I sometimes experience). These are absolutely perfect for camping and first aid. In the past we’ve done an improvisation with zip-lock bags, ice and dish towels. This is SO much better! The packs are a nice size to use on various body parts. They’re extremely easy to activate, just fold and pop the inner bubble, shake and apply. You get a pretty decent amount of cold time with a pack too. It actually lasts longer than the advised time for an ice application. I still find it helpful to wrap them in something though as they get very cold.In addition to camping supplies I’m distributing these to other areas where I can quickly access them. (You get 25 per order.) I’ve placed some in the kitchen cabinet, some in the bathrooms and even a few in our hurricane preparedness supplies. I’d put some in the car too, but I don’t know if heat could damage them. Perhaps someone else might know the answer to that.****About me: Integrity is very important to me. Reviews I've posted will be from items I've had direct contact with. These are my honest opinions. I will not post a review for a product I have not had personal contact with.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Hard to activate
reviews.reviewText: These are very convenient and work well once activated. The problem is that I was not able to activate one. I had to have my husband activate it. How humiliating. I folded it in half and squeezed and put it in a table and pushed on it, just couldn’t pop it. Anyway, it does work great and stays cold for at least 20 minutes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Instructions are to fold the bag over and apply pressure to it to pop the internal water bag that activates the cooling crystals. No amount of force I could apply would pop the interior water bag to get the cold going. I actually bruised my hand trying. Could have used an ice pack! LOL.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Instant Ice Cold Pack
reviews.reviewText: Great to have in first aid kits on the go when ice isn't accessible. Folding it and breaking the inner liquid pouch was a little scary for me at first because I didn't know how much pressure to use - a lot is needed and it makes me pretty confident these aren't going to get activated on their own in my kits. I did a test run with one, it gets cold fast and was at 31F within 2 minutes, at the 20 minute mark it was at 42F. This was just on my counter with a thermometer, obviously with body heat it will warm more quickly, but I'd say I should easily be able to get 15 minutes of cold to take the edge off. I didn't see an expiration date anywhere on these, so I'm hoping if they don't get used in a timely manner that the ingredients will be stable for at least a couple years. Would recommend these to anyone with kids on the move.
